headline: Hershey (HSY): Reassessing Valuation After Morgan Stanley’s Overweight Upgrade and Earnings Growth Outlook
summary: Morgan Stanley’s upgrade of Hershey (HSY) to Overweight is about more than a label change; it is a call that easing cocoa costs, improving fundamentals, and recent snack acquisitions could fuel a multiyear earnings uptrend. See our latest analysis for Hershey. That backdrop helps explain why the 7 day share price return of 4.1 percent and year to date share price return of 12.1 percent look like momentum is quietly rebuilding, even though the 3 year total shareholder return remains...

headline: Wall Street Upgrades And Salty Snack Push Could Be A Game Changer For Hershey (HSY)
summary: In recent days, several major Wall Street banks, including Morgan Stanley, Piper Sandler, Stifel Nicolaus, and JP Morgan, have upgraded their views on Hershey after the company delivered stronger-than-expected third-quarter 2025 results and progressed with its expansion into salty snacks through deals such as the LesserEvil acquisition. At the same time, S&P Global Ratings has shifted Hershey’s outlook to negative because of higher leverage and cocoa costs, underscoring that the improving...
